readability_reflection: Usually string interpolation, as it allows to perceive the whole string and see where the values are "inserted" rather than as a sequence of possibly mistaken concatenation (which based on language and/or order of characters can lead to different results)
comprehension_debugging: Yes, especially when having multiple values being first computed and then interpolated or concatenated as having interpolation facilitated understanding.
preference_rationale: Interpolation, for the afore mentioned reasons.
learning_curve: Various languages behave differently, having used Python and JavaScript a lot, some of their quirks caused me to "fumble" on certain questions and take more time to understand them
suggestions_improvement: Having a standard for programming languages to follow in order to ensure the order of interpolation and/or concatenation (such as str + int + int or int + int + str lead to diff results in some languages)
